Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


8+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? üîç

If your answer is yes, it‚Äôs your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! üëÄ




‚úçÔ∏èWHAT WILL YOU DO?

We are looking for a dynamic, proactive and talented person to join our team and perform the following tasks:

‚Ä¢ Working with stakeholders to understand the business problem they're trying to solve and the as-is landscape.

‚Ä¢ Collaborating with others and analyzing large unstructured, previously unseen datasets to source and build understanding of relevant data.

‚Ä¢ Building advanced SQL scripts to connect data from across our data lake to analyze and validate data mappings.

‚Ä¢ Identifying data anomalies and data quality issues and ensuring these are handled or flagged appropriately.

‚Ä¢ Choosing and deploying appropriate analytical and statistical techniques to understand issues, identify trends and forecast performance.

‚Ä¢ Working with architecture and technical (engineering) teams where required to develop robust, automated solutions for regular data and insights needs.

‚Ä¢ Working in an agile manner, ensuring the outputs required are in line with stakeholder expectations and delivered on-time.

‚Ä¢ Developing outputs to summarize analytical findings clearly for stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Interacting with various levels within the organization, from entry level team members to senior management.




üßê WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

‚Ä¢ Years' experience: minimum 5 years in a similar role

‚Ä¢ Fluent English

‚Ä¢ Experience of translating business problems into data solutions, adopting the most appropriate tools and techniques for the job.

‚Ä¢ Good understanding of financial services business concepts and key metrics.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of mathematical and statistical concepts and when to apply these.

‚Ä¢ Identifies research and reports on beneficial data usage opportunities in different departments or environments.

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills including:

1. Ability to provide observations and comment.

2. Wider-thinking and problem solving ‚Äì identifying and delivering reporting through own initiative.

3. Utilizing the data to build out a compelling narrative for stakeholders.

4. Understanding of the change management process.




üìÖ WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Remote (Candidate should live in Spain)
Work Schedule: Business Hours




ü§ù WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract üìã - We offer indefinite contracts from the first day.
Pay and benefits üí∏ - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan, Childcare Ticket, Transport Ticket and Health Insurance).
Work from home üèöÔ∏è - We offer you a financial support every month for your working from home expenses. In addition, in the first month we will give you a bonus to help you to set up your workplaceüë®‚Äçüíª
Opportunity knocks üëçüèª - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow üìö - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy üë´ - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you‚Äôll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally üåè - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
Benefit from being a TCSer üéüÔ∏è ‚Äì By being part of the TCS Spain family you can enjoy benefits, offers and corporate discounts on the best brands.
And so on üéâ - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




üí°WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968 as part of the Indian Tata Group and is one of the top 3 technology companies globally üöÄ




With a presence in 55 countries and more than 600,000 employees, TCS is considered one of the 10 best companies to work for worldwide in 2024 according to the Top Employers Institute ü•á




TCS Spain started operations in 2001 and currently has a diverse workforce that collaborates with the main Spanish and multinational companies üåè




TCS Spain has been certified as a Top Employer 2024 and has also been chosen as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work for in Spain in 2024 according to ForbesüèÜ




Among the portfolio of services, TCS has information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS üéØ




Responsible for development, TCS Spain is committed to inclusion, diversity and sustainability, and promotes flexibility policies that support wellbeing and work-life balance üíØ




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! üöÄ

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Responsibilities / Role

The difference you'll make:

Work with stakeholders to understand the business problem and the current landscape.

Collaborate with others and analyze large, unstructured datasets to identify relevant data.

Build advanced SQL scripts to connect data from across the data lake for analysis and validation.

Identify data anomalies and quality issues, ensuring proper handling or flagging.

Choose and apply appropriate analytical and statistical techniques to detect trends and forecast performance.

Work with architecture and technical (engineering) teams to develop automated solutions for data and insights.

Operate in an agile manner, aligning outputs with stakeholder expectations and delivering on time.

Develop reports that clearly summarize analytical findings for stakeholders.

Interact with various levels within the organization, from entry-level employees to senior management.

Mandatory Skills:

Experience translating business problems into data solutions, using appropriate tools and techniques.

Strong understanding of financial services business concepts and key metrics.

Knowledge of mathematical and statistical concepts and their applications.

Ability to research and report on beneficial data usage opportunities across different environments.

Strong analytical skills, including:


Providing observations and insights.
Problem-solving and identifying reporting solutions proactively.
Using data to create compelling narratives for stakeholders.
Understanding the change management process.




Nice-to-Have Skills:


Innovative management information tools and systems.
Governance and compliance policies (e.g., data security and records management).
Experience leading the development of advanced analytical scripts (SQL, Python, Impala/Hive/Snowflake).
Undergraduate degree or A-Level in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience supported by professional certifications/licenses (including STEM fields).

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Business Data Analyst
Company: Templeton & Partners - Innovative & Inclusive Hiring Solutions
Description:
Location: Madrid

Language: Spanish / English




About the role:

As a Functional Business Analyst in the Data Governance, Quality, and Extraction workstream, you will be integral to the development and management of a data governance tool. Your responsibilities will include:

Leading, together with the Product Owner, all workstreams within the data governance initiative.
Identifying, analyzing, and prioritizing user needs and functional requirements.
Managing the internal task backlog and negotiating execution and prioritization with the team.
Collaborating with the external tool provider to prioritize the backlog.
Validating the functionalities implemented in the tool and ensuring they meet the required specifications.
Managing and reviewing incidents, tracking progress, and ensuring solutions are implemented.
Organizing the preparation of deliverables and demos for users.
Attending and managing various meetings and committees.
Designing, reviewing, and validating requested dashboards, as well as calculating various KPIs.
Providing support and conducting testing.

EXPERIENCE / EDUCATION

2+ years of experience in a corporate environment.
Background in Data and familiarity with data governance practices.
Advanced English language skills required.

SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

Knowledge of data governance tools.
Experience with Agile methodology (JIRA, Confluence), including a solid understanding of meetings and task classifications.
Experience working with data exploitation tools, particularly PowerBI.
Knowledge of SQL and other programming languages (e.g., Python).
Experience with Azure Databricks.
Spanish/English proficiency required.




If you meet these qualifications and are excited to contribute to an innovative data governance project, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

Title: CS Insights Associate
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ‚Äôs success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you‚Äôll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they‚Äôre probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ‚Äôs Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world‚Äôs best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients‚Äô teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients‚Äô needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you‚Äôre uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:


Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover


Delivering Insight:


Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.


Workload Management and Prioritization:


Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable


REQUIREMENTS


Engaging presenter
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyze data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
Native in Spanish and good level of English


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world‚Äôs populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry‚Äôs top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what‚Äôs possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail


Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Madrid offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Hiring: Data Analyst




Are you passionate about People Analytics and Employee Listening? Join our team and help drive employee experience transformation through data-driven insights.




Location: Madrid (Hybrid position, 3 days on-site)

Contract Type: Contract for 6 months




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze Employee Listening data to identify trends and improvement areas.
Define and track key HR metrics (KPIs) related to employee engagement and experience.
Develop dashboards and reports to support strategic decision-making.
Apply predictive analytics and machine learning techniques to HR data.
Collaborate with HR and tech teams to integrate insights into the overall strategy.




Requirements:

Proven experience in People Analytics, HR Data, and Continuous Listening.
Strong knowledge of SQL, Python, R, Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools.
Expertise in HR metrics, reporting, and data visualization.
Ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights.
Fluent in English and Spanish.




Nice to Have:

Experience with Qualtrics, Workday, Medallia, Glint, or similar platforms.




Apply directly or send your CV to j.sierra@asenium.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge


Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.


Impact


Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.


Collaboration


Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.


Innovation


Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.


Specialisms

General


Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.


Data Modelling


Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.


Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).


Technical Skills


Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.


Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data analyst - (Remote - Europe/EU)
Description:
Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed, and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search.

For one of our clients, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem), remotely from Europe.

In this role, you will work with a dynamic and innovative team focused on exploring blockchain ecosystems to identify opportunities and risks. Your responsibilities will involve developing end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis to deployment, with a strong focus on optimization, scalability, and performance. You'll provide valuable insights to the team and community through informative dashboards, while also improving validation processes and working closely with the data engineering team. This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of decentralized finance with cutting-edge technologies.

Accountabilities:


Explore blockchain ecosystems, identifying potential opportunities and risks related to Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub
Design and develop comprehensive data solutions, from analysis to deployment, ensuring performance optimization and scalability
Build and maintain informative dashboards for internal teams, the company, and the wider community
Collaborate with data engineering teams to define data requirements, and ensure proper granularity, frequency, and data quality
Manage and govern team data marts, ensuring data lineage and providing actionable insights
Provide ad-hoc support to team members to address emerging data needs



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in advanced SQL (including joins and window expressions) and experience with Google BigQuery
Competence in analytical programming languages such as Python, with experience in the analytical stack
Experience with ETL tools like Airflow and dbt
Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Strong skills in data research, probability theory, and mathematical statistics, including regressions and A/B testing
Proven ability to tell compelling data stories and present your analysis with clear insights
Familiarity with cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is a plus
Proficiency in English (B2+ or higher)



Benefits


Competitive salary, with the option to receive payments in cryptocurrency
Well-being program and mental health care support
Compensation for educational programs, including foreign language courses and professional development
Reimbursement for equipment and co-working spaces
Opportunities to attend overseas conferences and engage with the global community
Positive, friendly, and collaborative communication culture
P2P.org is an equal opportunity employer, offering a diverse and inclusive work environment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values

  • Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
  • Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
  • Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
  • Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
  • Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include

  • Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
  • Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
  • Renewable technology supplier leaderboards

Responsibilities

  • Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
  • Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
  • Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
  • Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
  • Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
  • Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
  • Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
  • Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements

About You

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
  • Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
  • Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
  • Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
  • Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
  • Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
  • Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
  • Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
  • Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
  • Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: BI & Reporting Lead
Description:
The BI & Reporting Lead will be responsible for designing and implementing the overall Business Intelligence & Reporting strategy within the organization. This role focuses on developing and maintaining reporting frameworks, data visualization solutions, and analytics tools to drive data-driven decision-making. It ensures data accuracy, consistency, and accessibility while aligning with business objectives and performance goals.




The ideal candidate should have strong expertise in BI tools, data analytics, and reporting methodologies, combined with excellent leadership, communication, and project management skills. This role requires the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, translate business needs into actionable insights, and enhance reporting capabilities to support strategic initiatives.




The BI & Reporting Lead plays a key role in optimizing business performance through effective reporting solutions and digital transformation efforts. They act as a strategic partner within the organization and report directly to the Global Architect & Data Director.




SKILLS, EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS

Proven experience in Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting, with a strong technical background in data acquisition, storage, processing, and visualization for both operational and analytical domains.
Extensive experience in data migration projects, transitioning high-volume datasets from legacy reporting systems to cloud-native BI solutions.
Strong expertise in major ERPs (Oracle, SAP, Microsoft) with a track record of successful implementations and rollouts.
Experience in complex, multi-country, multi-cultural, matrix environments, ensuring seamless collaboration and reporting consistency across global teams.
Deep understanding of Data Governance, Data Security, Data Cataloging, and Data Lineage, ensuring compliance and data integrity within BI & reporting frameworks.
Excellent technical, analytical, and project management skills to lead and deliver large-scale BI & reporting initiatives.
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, enabling collaboration with stakeholders and cross-functional teams.
Ability to align BI & Reporting with the overall business strategy, ensuring data-driven decision-making supports strategic goals.
Strong communication skills to effectively articulate BI & reporting strategies, plans, and insights to stakeholders, business leaders, and IT teams.
Proven problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify risks, manage challenges, and implement effective BI & reporting solutions.
Knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards related to data management, security, and reporting compliance.
Familiarity with emerging BI technologies and trends, with the ability to evaluate and integrate innovative reporting tools and methodologies.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to work under pressure in fast-paced environments.
Effective team player, working collaboratively across IS/IT and business teams to drive BI & reporting success.
Ability to influence and align stakeholders, ensuring buy-in and adoption of BI & reporting strategies and tools.
Valuable knowledge of DAMA principles and experience working within its framework for data management and governance.




If you are interested do not hesitate, apply to the job opportunity and upload your CV in english!

Title: CRM Data Analyst - Spain
Description:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek a Data Analyst who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

What will help you succeed:


Dashboard development: Design and build interactive dashboards that enable clear visualization of KPIs and informed decision making.
Data analysis: Extract, transform, and analyze data from different sources to generate actionable insights and strategic recommendations.
Business Case Generation: Develop data models and business cases that support customer and stakeholder decision making.
Visual Representations: Create effective visualizations that communicate data analysis findings in an impactful way.
Optimization of digital marketing strategies: Provide data-driven recommendations to improve campaign performance and investment efficiency.
Collaboration with cross-functional teams: Work closely with Martech, Adtech, Product and Development teams to align strategies and business objectives.
Data quality control: Oversee the quality of data used in analytics, ensuring data integrity and consistency.



Requirements:


Educational background: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Marketing, Computer Science or related fields.
Experience: Minimum 4 years of experience in data analysis, especially in digital marketing environments.
Analytical tools: Proficient in tools such as Google Analytics and Salesforce CRM Analytics.
Previous experience in CRM data analysis.
Business Intelligence Skills: Experience in extracting, transforming and loading (ETL) data for representation in dashboards.
Analytics Methodologies: Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques, audience segmentation and marketing attribution.
Digital marketing skills: Understanding of SEO/SEM, programmatic, email marketing, and social media strategies.
English: Intermediate-advanced level, able to work and present in international environments.
Desirable: Experience with CDP and DMP platforms, as well as certifications in data visualization tools or agile methodologies.



This job can be filled in MADRID or or .

Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant‚Äôs Benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Plexus Tech. We are looking for a Data Analyst to work on a project in the banking sector in the UK.

Requirements


Proactive technical analyst with experience in large data sets, data comparison and gap analysis.
Experience working with data.
Able to write and understand medium/complex SQL queries.
Experienced Excel user.
Experience working in Hadoop, HUE, Impala, Hive.
environments.


With our hybrid model, Flexology, you can work from wherever your talent flows best: from any of the 24 work centers we have in Spain, from your home, or combining both modalities. Plexus Tech s work ecosystem allows for a collaborative environment to be maintained in the company.


Work with leading professionals.
Access to ongoing training.
Professional development.
Flexible remuneration in health insurance, restaurant vouchers, childcare, transportation.

Necesitamos a alguien como t√∫ para que nos ayude en distintos √°mbitos:

  • Dise√±os funcionales y construcci√≥n t√©cnica de ETLs.
  • Desarrollo y actualizaci√≥n de interfaces de intercambio de datos (Python).
  • Ingesta de datos y mantenimiento del repositorio unificado de datos de la compa√±√≠a (DWH).
  • Optimizaci√≥n y automatizaci√≥n de procesos.
  • Extracci√≥n de datos y generaci√≥n de informes.
  • Validaci√≥n de la integridad de los datos (an√°lisis de carteras NPL/REO).
  • Participaci√≥n en proyectos de transformaci√≥n y anal√≠tica de datos.
  • Soporte a los modelos predictivos de IA actuales y an√°lisis de nuevos modelos seg√∫n necesidades.

Para esta posici√≥n ser√° necesario:

Requisitos:

  • +3 a√±os de experiencia, tanto en programaci√≥n (.Net, Python), como en extracci√≥n, transformaci√≥n y carga de datos (ETL/ELT).
  • Conocimiento en herramientas nativas de Google Cloud Platform (Dataform, BigQuery‚Ä¶).
  • Uso avanzado del paquete Office (Word, PPT, Excel).
  • SQL avanzado.

Valorable:

  • Conocimientos en metodolog√≠a DevOps.
  • Se valorar√° positivamente el conocimiento en Dockers, Kubernetes, Looker y Airflow.
  • Nivel de ingl√©s fluido.
  • Desarrollo de modelos predictivos (conocimiento en modelos predictivos y Machine Learning).

Educaci√≥n:

  • Grado/Licenciatura en carreras t√©cnicas: matem√°ticas, ingenier√≠a, estad√≠stica...
  • Se valorar√° positivamente un Postgrado en Data.

En Santander, somos responsables de identificar, evaluar, gestionar y comunicar cualquier riesgo derivado del desempe√±o de sus funciones y profundizar continuamente en el conocimiento de los riesgos. Banco Santander facilitar√° formaci√≥n y herramientas para ayudarle a gestionar los riesgos de su puesto. Esta cultura del riesgos, que llamamos Risk Pro, es un pilar fundamental de Santander Way, nuestra forma de trabaja.

OTRA INFORMACI√ìN

Si quieres conocer m√°s sobre nosotros, visita nuestra web https://www.betechwithsantander.com/en/home

Title: Data Graduate Program
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre Fever

We‚Äôre excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

What is this program about?

Are you a recent graduate eager to kickstart your career in data? Fever‚Äôs Data Graduate Program is a unique six-month rotational program designed to give you hands-on experience in Data Engineering, Machine Learning, and Data Science.

You‚Äôll be working on real projects from day one, using cutting-edge technologies, and learning from experienced professionals in a fast-growing, global tech company. By the end of the program, you‚Äôll have gained skills and experiences that typically take years to build, setting you up for a successful career in the data field.

What‚Äôs in it for you?


A paid six-month contract in Madrid, with the opportunity to transition into a full-time role.
Rotation across key data teams (Data Engineering, Machine Learning, Data Science and Web Analytics).
Mentorship and training from experts in the field.
A fast-paced, high-impact learning environment where you‚Äôll contribute from day one.
English lessons.
40% discount on all Fever events.
Cigna Health Insurance.
Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee.
Gympass Membership.


How does the program work?


Location: Madrid, Spain (100% in-person)
Rotation Structure: 6 months total, rotating across 3-4 teams depending on your skills and interests:
Data Engineering: Learn how to build and manage scalable data pipelines. Work with tools like SQL, Python, and cloud-based databases.
Machine Learning: Work on real-world ML models and recommendations. Learn how ML models are developed, trained, and deployed.
Data Science: Analyze complex business problems and help drive data-driven decisions. Use A/B testing and predictive modeling to optimize Fever‚Äôs platform.
Web Analytics & Data Collection: Improve how data is collected across the complex Fever ecosystem (multiple websites and mobile apps) to deliver the best quality inputs to all internal areas and stakeholders to make better decisions. You'll learn about best practices for tracking and analytics using technologies such as GA4 and Mixpanel.
Contract Type: ‚ÄúContrato de pr√°cticas‚Äù (you must have completed all credits to apply).

Who should apply?

We‚Äôre looking for motivated, ambitious recent graduates who:


Have a bachelor / master's / PhD degree in Data Engineering, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Mathematics or a related field.
Are among the top 10% of their class and have a strong academic record.
Are curious, eager to learn, and excited to work in a fast-growing company.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Have all your credits completed.
Speak and understand business-level English.


How to apply?


Submit your application and select your preferred team.
Talent interview to assess fit.
Technical interview to evaluate skills.
Final offer and onboarding.


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Business Intelligence and Performance Data Analyst
Description:
About Signify

At Signify, you can shape tomorrow by building on our incredible 125+ year legacy while working toward even bolder sustainability goals. Our culture of continuous learning, creativity, and commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers you to grow your skills and career.

Join us, and together, we‚Äôll transform our industry, making a lasting difference for brighter lives and a better world. You light the way.

More About The Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and results-driven Business Intelligence and Performance Data Analyst with advanced expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Snowflake to join the Global Commercial Excellence Team in Madrid with Signify.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights, helping our business make data-driven decisions. You will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and visualizing data to support various business functions, with a strong focus on utilizing SQL, Power BI, and Snowflake to deliver impactful reports and dashboards.

Key Responsibilities


Data Extraction & Analysis:
Use SQL to query, manipulate, and transform data from Snowflake and other data sources (databases, data warehouses, and APIs).
Work with Snowflake to perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) tasks.
Ensure optimal performance for queries and dashboards within the Snowflake data warehouse environment.
Perform data cleansing, validation, and aggregation to ensure data quality and integrity.
Conduct advanced data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business objectives.
Power BI Reporting & Visualization:
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI.
Utilize advanced Power BI features such as DAX, Power Query, and custom visualizations to create insightful reports.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and develop custom dashboards tailored to business needs.
Technical Skills:
Advanced proficiency in SQL, with hands-on experience in writing complex queries, joins, subqueries, and data manipulation.
Advanced skills in Power BI, including report creation, data modeling, DAX, Power Query, and custom visualizations.
Strong experience working with Snowflake, including database design, data extraction, transformation, and querying.
Strong understanding of relational databases, data warehousing concepts, and cloud-based data platforms.
Soft Skills:
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis, SQL, Power BI, and Snowflake.
Problem-solving attitude and ability to think critically and provide insight and guidance on best practices for commercial (sales and marketing) processes.
Coaching and developing analytics capabilities in the Commercial Excellence team.

More About You

While we value and appreciate all applicants, we believe that the following experience and skills will be needed to shine brightly in this job opening:


Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems preferred.
Experience:
2+ years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a focus on SQL, Power BI, and Snowflake.
Proven track record of building and maintaining advanced Power BI dashboards and reports.
Experience with large datasets and data integration from multiple sources.
Familiarity with Snowflake's architecture and best practices for optimizing performance and scalability.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear and meaningful way.

Everything we‚Äôll do for you

You can grow a lasting career here. We‚Äôll encourage you, support you, and challenge you. We‚Äôll help you learn and progress in a way that‚Äôs right for you, with coaching and mentoring along the way. We‚Äôll listen to you too, because we see and value every one of our 30,000+ people.

We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a full spectrum of bright ideas. With a global workforce representing 99 nationalities, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where every voice is heard and valued, helping us all achieve more together.

Title: Business Data Analyst en Customer Intelligence
Description:
Description And Requirements

¬øTe apetece unirte a Endesa?

Estamos buscando a una persona para poder trabajar como Consultor/a Customer Intelligence en nuestra sede en Madrid o Sevilla.

Te contamos un poco m√°s.

En Endesa ponemos al cliente en el centro de nuestra estrategia basada en mejorar la eficiencia y la experiencia del cliente. Nuestro equipo aplica t√©cnicas de Advanced Analytics innovadoras que permiten conocer mejor a nuestro cliente, ofrecerle productos y servicios personalizados e incrementar su satisfacci√≥n.

Trabajar√°s desarrollando e implementando modelos de advanced analytics con un alto impacto econ√≥mico en el negocio. En particular tus responsabilidades incluir√°n:

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Probar hip√≥tesis a partir de conjuntos de datos sin procesar y extraer conclusiones significativas (ej. mantenimiento predictivo, o mejora de control de calidad)

Colaborar con otras plantas de la compa√±√≠a a nivel global para compartir y replicar soluciones. Participar en proyectos internacionales relacionados con anal√≠tica de datos.
Apoyarse en equipos globales y empresas externas para proveer a la planta de soluciones que resuelvan las oportunidades identificadas.

Se valorar√° el conocimiento de entornos regulados y/o farmac√©uticos (GMP, 21 CFR part 11)
Se valorar√° experiencia internacional o colaboraci√≥n con proyectos a nivel global
Buena comunicaci√≥n (oral y escrita). Buena capacidad de s√≠ntesis y que sea capaz de adaptar el mensaje al nivel t√©cnico de la audiencia
Influencia y liderazgo no jer√°rquico

Title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
Description:
SGS is the world‚Äôs leading Testing, Inspection and Certification company. We operate a network of over 2,500 laboratories and business facilities across 115 countries, supported by a team of 99,500 dedicated professionals with over 145 years of service excellence.




Job Description

As part of our Global Technology Office (GTO), you will play a key role in shaping and implementing our global data governance strategy. We are seeking a Senior Data Governance Analyst to drive the development and execution of data governance frameworks, ensuring data quality, accountability, and consistency across the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy aligned with overall business objectives.
Collaborate with key stakeholders ‚Äî including business units, regional teams, process owners (labs and field services), corporate functions, and the data privacy office ‚Äî to identify data owners and establish clear accountability.
Define and document data governance policies and data quality rules, ensuring consistent application across the organization.
Lead the implementation of a Data Governance and Data Quality platform to support governance frameworks and tools.
Monitor and report on data governance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data governance and data management.




Qualifications

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Management, or a related field.
Experience: 5+ years in data governance, data management, or a related role, ideally in the testing, certification, or inspection industry.
Technical Expertise: Strong understanding of data governance frameworks and tools such as Collibra, Alation, Informatica, or Microsoft Purview.
Leadership: Proven success in building and guiding high-performing teams.
Certifications: CDMP, CISSP, or similar data governance/management certifications are a plus.
Tools Knowledge: Familiarity with data quality monitoring tools.




Skills:

Languages: Strong written and verbal communication skills in Spanish and English; additional languages are a plus.
Project Management: Ability to lead and deliver data-related initiatives on time and within scope.
Collaboration: Skilled at working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.
Analytical Thinking: Ability to translate complex ideas into clear, actionable steps.
Communication: Excellent ability to convey technical concepts in a clear and accessible manner, both verbally and in writing.




Additional Information

Why SGS?

Join a globally recognized and stable company, a leader in the Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC) industry.
Enjoy a flexible schedule and work model.
Access continuous learning opportunities through SGS University and Campus.
Collaborate in a multinational environment with colleagues from various continents.
Benefit from a comprehensive benefits platform.




Apply Now:

At SGS, we are committed to fostering an open, friendly, and supportive culture that thrives on teamwork. We value diversity and provide endless opportunities to learn, grow your expertise, and fulfill your potential. Apply now to join our motivated and dynamic team!
