Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.

Job Description

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success

Job Purpose

As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.

Main Duties


Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor‚Äôs Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures


Qualifications

Skills:


Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment


What We Offer


A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.


Additional Information

If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.

Location and Availability Requirements:


Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

What It‚Äôs Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About This Role

Gartner RESSO(Research Engagement Services Strategy and Operations) is looking for a Data Analytics who has a passion for analytical problem solving to be part of our growing team. This individual will solve a wide range of problems related to content analytics, and interaction analytics, demand sensing, staffing models, cost reporting, automation, standard reporting, and ad-hoc analytics. Individuals in this role will work closely with RESSO leadership to structure problems, identify data sources, perform analysis, and communicate findings. Strong performers will build skills to independently own project workstreams and interact with stakeholders. Projects will include a mix of team problem solving and independent problem solving. Some projects will also involve automation and collaboration with the Information Technology team.

What You‚Äôll Do


Partner with RESSO colleagues to do analysis that surfaces actionable insight for the RES organization. Effectively communicate findings to drive adoption and implementation.
Project ownership: Contribute to key projects like RES service level analytics, associate performance analytics, etc.
Leads the development of custom Power BI dashboards, interactive deliverables, and innovative prototypes to enhance asset team and delivery consultant productivity gains.
Develop and maintain custom build SQL queries as the Power BI report data source and address ad-hoc analytics requests.
Domain expertise: Become a deep subject-matter expert on Gartner‚Äôs data, analytic tools, reports & data infrastructure. Take responsibility for problem solving, root cause analysis, and devising testing methodologies for validation and articulately explaining data sources to senior audiences.
Continuous improvement: Support and enable improvement initiatives related both to RESSO deliverables (e.g. new data products, innovative data sources, analytic insights, tools) as well as operational process improvement (e.g. improving RESSO processes and communications).


What You‚Äôll Need


Experience: 3-4 years of experience involving analysis of large volumes of data with strong hands-on experience with analytical tools. Ability to gather, analyze, restructure, identify and articulate insights from qualitative and quantitative data Ability to creatively design the user experience of data visualizations, dashboards, and reports leveraging Power BI
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, preferably with a quantitative concentration (e.g., statistics, data science, mathematics, engineering, operational research, computer science, or economics)
Exceptional problem solving: Proven track record of solving complex problems, thinking creatively, and using data to tell a story.
Communication: excellent written and verbal communication skills with the desire to share technical knowledge and information with others.
Technical competency: Strong expertise in SQL for data access and transformation. implementing Reporting, BI, Visualization and Analytics tools in Power BI
Strong organizational skills within a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
A curious and inquisitive mind, with an openness to new experiences and learning


Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:97388

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capitole Consulting is growing, and we want you to be part of it!

We are looking for a Tableau Data Analyst




Requirements:

Experience Level: minimum 2 years in an analytical role and proficiency in English.




Technical Skills:

Tableau proficiency: experience in creating dashboards and visualizations, including advanced features like calculated fields, parameters, and actions.
Strong SQL skills: ability to query, manage, and analyze large datasets.
Solid understanding of data structures, relational databases, and ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




Daily Responsibilities:

Use SQL to query databases, extract and prepare clean datasets for analysis and reporting.
Update and enhance Tableau dashboards to ensure accuracy, functionality, and relevance for stakeholders.
Generate and distribute automated reports, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide data-driven insights to support business decisions.
Validate data accuracy in dashboards and reports, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability across all outputs.
Collaborate with teams to understand their data needs, provide insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.
Continuously refine SQL queries, Tableau workflows, and reporting processes while staying up to date with industry best practices and new tools.




Why Join Us?

We are amazing, but with you, we‚Äôll be even better! üòä

Benefits:

‚Ç¨1,200 training budget to use on tech events, books, certifications, or courses of your choice.
Monthly team check-ins for continuous feedback.
Flexible working hours to balance your professional and personal life.
Private health insurance, fully covered by Capitole.
Flexible compensation options (meal vouchers, transport, daycare).
Andjoy (Gymforless) membership.
Exclusive employee discounts at top brands through Club Capitole.

Team Culture & Social Perks:

Team buildings every two months ‚Äì don‚Äôt miss our Summer Party or Christmas Dinner!
Capitole-sponsored football team.
Tech communities to share knowledge and ideas across teams ‚Äì internal knowledge sharing is key! üòÉ

Want to know more about us?

üåê Check us out: https://capitole-consulting.com/ ‚≠ê See what employees say: Glassdoor Reviews

Don‚Äôt hesitate to send us your profile ‚Äì we‚Äôre excited to meet you! üöÄ

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üè¢ About Us



We are a software company developing CRM solutions for the healthcare sector, trusted by top healthcare providers across Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, and beyond. Since 2019, we have been part of DocPlanner Group, Europe and Latin America's leading healthtech SaaS unicorn, dedicated to transforming healthcare and enhancing the patient experience.



For more about us, visit https://www.tuotempo.es/





Job Description



üéØ The Role



We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona! üöÄ
As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.



üîç Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities



Data Analysis (40%) ‚Äì Extract, analyze, and interpret data to generate actionable insights.
Data Visualization (30%) ‚Äì Build dashboards and reports using Looker, Tableau, or similar tools.
Data Quality (20%) ‚Äì Ensure accuracy and consistency in data sources.
Data Modeling (10%) ‚Äì Support business teams with modeling and structuring data for analysis.

You will collaborate closely with Product, DevOps, Backend, and Operations teams, working on 80% project-based tasks and 20% ad-hoc requests.





Qualifications



‚ú® What Will Make You Shine



üõ† Must-Have Requirements



1-2 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills ‚Äì ability to translate data into insights.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì ability to present data clearly and concisely.
Fluent in English (Italian and Spanish are a plus).
Attention to detail ‚Äì high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.

üè¢ About Us

We are a software company developing CRM solutions for the healthcare sector, trusted by top healthcare providers across Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, and beyond. Since 2019, we have been part of DocPlanner Group, Europe and Latin America's leading healthtech SaaS unicorn, dedicated to transforming healthcare and enhancing the patient experience.

For more about us, visit https://www.tuotempo.es/



Job Description

üéØ The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona! üöÄ
As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

üîç Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Data Analysis (40%) ‚Äì Extract, analyze, and interpret data to generate actionable insights.
  • Data Visualization (30%) ‚Äì Build dashboards and reports using Looker, Tableau, or similar tools.
  • Data Quality (20%) ‚Äì Ensure accuracy and consistency in data sources.
  • Data Modeling (10%) ‚Äì Support business teams with modeling and structuring data for analysis.

You will collaborate closely with Product, DevOps, Backend, and Operations teams, working on 80% project-based tasks and 20% ad-hoc requests.



Qualifications

‚ú® What Will Make You Shine

üõ† Must-Have Requirements

  • 1-2 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company.
  • Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
  • Strong analytical skills ‚Äì ability to translate data into insights.
  • Excellent communication skills ‚Äì ability to present data clearly and concisely.
  • Fluent in English (Italian and Spanish are a plus).
  • Attention to detail ‚Äì high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.

üéØ Nice-to-Have Requirements

  • Experience with Python or other programming languages.
  • Familiarity with BigQuery, AWS, or other data warehousing solutions.
  • Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
  • Experience in product damanagement, SaaS, or tech industry.
  • Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.

  • Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.

Title: Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Our opportunity

Life is too short to just tick the box. Reimagine the box with Zurich!

Would you like to be part of a trainee program that helps you gain experience with newest technologies and build up the business knowhow in one of the biggest insurers in the world?

During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

Are you enthusiastic about data analysis? Do you enjoy working with learning & development data? Do you excel in dynamic environments where your contributions can truly make a difference? If so, we have an exciting opportunity waiting for you!

As our Data Analysis Intern, you will have the chance to:


Assist in the crucial tasks of data cleaning and preparation to ensure our learning & development data is accurate and ready for analysis.
Utilize your advanced Excel skills to perform in-depth analysis and derive actionable insights from complex datasets.
Design and develop compelling Power BI dashboards that vividly illustrate key trends and metrics.
Play an essential role in the ongoing updates and maintenance of our data, ensuring its reliability and relevance.
Take the lead on a small data automation project, showcasing your ability to innovate and streamline our data processes.


Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:


Skilled in Data Analytics Tools & Techniques, and Data Modeling.
Has knowledge in Python, DAX, or/ and R
Proficient in Excel and Power BI
Experienced with Automation
Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
University student interested in developing career in tech field
Looking for at least 9 months part-time/internship program
Tech savvy approach
An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
Able to use English for daily communication with colleagues and managers from abroad


Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:


Paid Internship
Up to 30 hs weekly with Flexible schedule
LinkedIn, Coursera and internal training opportunities
Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
Free coffee and fruit at the office.


Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou.

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don‚Äôt wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

You are the heart & soul of Zurich!

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.

Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Schedule: Part Time
Recruiter name: Alba Marin Sola

Title: Nespresso - Data Analyst
Description:
Position Snapshot:


Location: Esplugues de Llobregat, Barcelona, Spain
Type of Contract: Permanent
Business: Nespresso


The Role:

Provide insights to improve the consumer experience and business results by collecting, combining and translating data on customers (behavior), consumers, prospects, market and competition, both B2C and B2B.

We offer you:‚ÄØ

We offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.‚ÄØ


Great benefits including salary and a comprehensive social benefits package. We have one of the best pension plans on the market, as well as flexible remuneration with tax advantages: health insurance, restaurant card, mobility plan, etc.‚ÄØ
Personal and professional growth through ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important asset.‚ÄØ
Hybrid working environment with flexible working scheme. Our state-of-the-art campus is dog friendly and equipped with a medical center, canteen and areas to co-create network and chill!‚ÄØ
Recreation activities such as yoga, Zumba, etc. and a wide range of volunteering activities.


What you‚Äôll do:


Collect, combine and analyse insights
Define indicators to ensure the measurement of results
Collect and combine external data (e.g. market trends, consumers and competitors) and internal data (e.g. channels, key campaigns and ongoing programs)
Update the database with all internal and external data and clean, maintain and enrich the database to optimize data quality
Perform (adhoc) analyses (deep dives) based on data on e.g. segmentation for B2C and B2B channels, regions and sales channels, both reactively and proactively
Develop forecasting & predictive models to generate long-term insights


Provide insights
Translate data from analyses requested by all departments into actionable recommendations for all business initiatives, e.g. the consumer journey strategy, campaign management
Assist channels in their forecasting activities


Standard reporting
Provide periodic reporting on key KPI's and expected developments to MT stakeholders, sales channels and HQ, e.g. data on active base, average consumption and channel preference
Complement reports with bottom-up channel views
Monitor and report relevant trends within the database and communicate them within the organization on regular basis
Provide evaluation reports of consumer experience campaigns

What will make you a great fit?


Education:
University degree in Mathematics/Statistics/Econometrics/Quantitative Marketing or similar


Professional experience:
Minimum of 2-3 years experience in data mining/ CRM/ Direct Marketing
Proven competency in project management
Knowledge of SPSS/SAS or similar statistics package, and Cognos / SQL or other data query tool
Analytical experience using software tools in a business oriented environment
Fluent in Spanish and English


Preferably also:
Experience with geoanalytical software (Regiograph, Mapinfo, etc)
Experience in retention activities and churn risk modeling
Experience with campaign management tools

About Nestl√©

We are Nestl√©, the largest food and beverage company with brands including KitKat, Nescaf√©, Maggi, Purina, among many others. We are approximately 275,000 employees strong, motivated by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 94.4‚ÄØbillion sales in 2022, we have an expansive presence, with 344‚ÄØfactories in 77‚ÄØcountries. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

‚ÄØ

We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.‚ÄØ

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôre an important part of our future.

Hopefully, we're also a part of yours! At B. Braun, we protect and improve the health of people worldwide. This is also our vision for IT. You see technology as an opportunity, and you develop solutions that secure our business in the long term, we would like to implement the digital transformation of B. Braun with you. With fresh ideas, drive and team spirit, we are working to launch the medical technology of tomorrow and safeguard the healthcare of the future. Together. That's Sharing Expertise.

Data Analyst

Reference Code ES-COJ-DOI-XXXXXX

From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. Our goal is to augment caregivers‚Äô decision-making with data-driven insights, predictive analytics, and AI-powered solutions. Our cloud platform team is focused on creating corporate-wide solutions that will drive the next generation of B. Braun‚Äôs digital products and connected devices. The technologies and products we develop create new treatment possibilities, enable sharing of clinical experience, and result in better patient care. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Duties and responsibilities


You collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions.
You design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies.
You create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
You collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions.
You develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making.
You ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
You work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices.


Professional competencies


You have several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry.
You have strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling.
You have experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake.
You are proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
You have a strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
You have experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams.
You are familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus).
You have experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus).


Personal competencies


You are a proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills.
You work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support.
You have a hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights.
You stay productive and capable of acting in critical situations.
You communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have.


What we offer

Join a company that combines the innovation and agility of a start-up with the stability and global reach of a healthcare leader. By working with us, you'll be part of a team dedicated to improving people's health and healthcare services. Our corporate culture values accountability, diversity, and trust. Embrace a highly motivated international team, flat hierarchies, and fast decision-making. Barcelona, a vibrant city with a high quality of life, is an ideal location for you to grow professionally and personally.

Benefits


Flexible and family-oriented working hours and hybrid working between office and home.
Modern office optimized for concentration and collaboration, featuring an integrated high-tech simulation operating room, and generous social areas and creativity zones.
Experience the rich cultural offerings, architectural beauty, and warm climate of Barcelona.
Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning within an international team that fosters collaboration and innovation.
Attractive private healthcare insurance conditions.


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Soledad Barrag√°n L√≥pez | +347294

Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview

The Celergo Streamline Organization (CSL) is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring, developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to clients and associates.

Within the CSL Implementation department we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to lead data analysis and reporting efforts within the department.

What will I be doing?


You will formulate analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations
You will work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects
You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
You will be a champion for data-based decision making
You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes


What skills will I need?


You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined.
You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset


How will I know that I am successful at it?


Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels
Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller


Qualifications And Experience


3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus.
Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
University degree or equivalent in education or experience.


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

HTML:
Overview

The Celergo Streamline Organization (CSL) is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring, developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to clients and associates.

Within the CSL Implementation department we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to lead data analysis and reporting efforts within the department.

What will I be doing?

  • You will formulate analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations
  • You will work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects
  • You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
  • You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
  • You will be a champion for data-based decision making
  • You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
  • You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes

What skills will I need?

  • You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
  • You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
  • You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
  • You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
  • You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
  • You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
  • You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
  • You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
  • You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined.
  • You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
  • You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
  • You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
  • You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset

How will I know that I am successful at it?

  • Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
  • Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels
  • Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller

Qualifications And Experience

  • 3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
  • Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
  • Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus.
  • Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
  • Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
  • You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
  • Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
  • University degree or equivalent in education or experience.

A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions
Design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies
Create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions
Develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making
Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements
Work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices


Professional competencies:


Several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
Experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams
Familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus)
Experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus)


Personal competencies:


Proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills
Work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support
Hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights
Productive and capable of acting in critical situations
Communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Soledad Barrag√°n L√≥pez

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you‚Äôll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry‚Äôs top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city‚Äôs best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.
