About Sanoma Learning

How do you prepare students for the world, engage their curiosity and inspire them to grow? That is the main question of teachers all around the world. At Sanoma Learning, it has always been our mission to help to find and develop best-in-class answers to this question. If you join us, it means that you embark on an exciting journey to help shape the future of learning for primary, secondary and vocational education. We believe that your journey is our success as a company.

Sanoma Learning is a leading K12 European learning company, operating in 12 countries. Our learning products and services enable and support teachers and schools to develop the talents of every child to reach their potential. By offering printed and digital learning content, as well as digital learning and teaching platforms for primary, secondary and vocational education, we want to grow our positive impact on learning across Europe. With over 3000 employees, we help shape the future of education for 25+ million of students.

So, are you ready to start your journey to help shape the future of learning and help teachers to support all students to reach their potential?

Sanoma Learning is an equal opportunity employer; we are committed to inclusion and diversity, ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Somos una compa√±√≠a global, l√≠der en el desarrollo de infraestructuras regenerativas que generan un impacto positivo en la sociedad. Nuestra plantilla, formada por m√°s de 65.000 profesionales y presente en m√°s de 40 pa√≠ses de los cinco continentes, contribuye a nuestra misi√≥n de dise√±ar un planeta mejor. Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desaf√≠os globales, incluidos el cambio clim√°tico, la sobrepoblaci√≥n y la escasez h√≠drica. √önete a nosotros en la b√∫squeda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.

Descripci√≥n del puesto

El/La Data Analyst ser√° responsable de la construcci√≥n y mantenimiento de dashboards en PowerBI, la definici√≥n y gesti√≥n de KPIs y la creaci√≥n de data products para apoyar la toma de decisiones del negocio. Adem√°s, liderar√° la identificaci√≥n, documentaci√≥n y migraci√≥n de los servicios de datos actuales hacia una nueva arquitectura medall√≥n en GCP, asegurando la trazabilidad y gobernanza de los datos.

Requisitos del candidato

PRINCIPALES FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES


Dise√±ar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Power BI que proporcionen informaci√≥n clave para las √°reas de negocio.
Identificar y documentar los servicios de datos existentes (CdM, dashboards, KPIs, informes), asegurando la trazabilidad y calidad de los datos.
Liderar la migraci√≥n de los servicios de datos actuales a una arquitectura medall√≥n en GCP, garantizando la continuidad y optimizaci√≥n del an√°lisis de datos.
Actuar como interfaz con las √°reas de negocio para entender sus necesidades anal√≠ticas y traducirlas en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Colaborar con el Data Engineer en el dise√±o y modelado de datamarts optimizados para la explotaci√≥n en Power BI.
Impulsar la gobernanza de datos en la empresa mediante la construcci√≥n de un Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.


PERFIL DE LA PERSONA


Formaci√≥n reglada: Ingenier√≠a inform√°tica o similar.
Formaci√≥n no reglada / Complementaria: S√≥lidos conocimientos de modelados de datos y definici√≥n de datamarts en entornos anal√≠ticos. Conocimiento de arquitecturas de datos modernas, preferiblemente en Google Cloud Platform, y experiencia en migraciones de datos. Conocimientos en Data Governance, con capacidad para estructurar y construir en Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.
Experiencia: M√°s de 5 a√±os en posici√≥n similar. Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de dashboards y modelos de datos en Power BI. Experiencia en la documentaci√≥n de flujos de datos, trazabilidad y gobernanza de datos. Experiencia en SQL y herramientas ETL para transformaci√≥n y an√°lisis de datos ser√° valorada.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do



Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton‚Äôs privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy



Job Requirements



Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.



Bonus points for:



Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)

CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:

  • Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
  • Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
  • Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
  • Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
  • Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.

Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:

  • Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
  • Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
  • Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
  • Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.

The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:

  • Customer Service Operations
  • Shared Service Center
  • Master Data Global Teams
  • IT CoE

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:

  • Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
  • 2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
  • Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
  • Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
  • Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).

Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:

  • Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
  • Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
  • Company products / Access to the company shop
  • Life and accident insurance

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • A screening call with the recruiters
  • A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
  • A second interview (optionally)
  • Feedback, verbal offer
  • Hiring

About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission

Your mission

Skills

We are looking for a highly motivated Marketing Data Analyst to join our Growth and Marketing team. In this role you will work closely with growth, marketing, product, and business teams to drive growth and optimize marketing efforts by delivering actionable insights through data analysis, and supporting data-driven decision-making. This will be a highly analytical role, that will require a mix of cross-collaboration, operations, creativity and strong communication skills. More specifically you will be responsible for the following:


Work with growth and marketing to identify opportunities to optimize always on activities and campaigns, and drive overall growth and marketing success.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics (KPIs), and implement specific dashboards to support leadership.
Analyze data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights to inform growth and marketing decisions.
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for growth and marketing teams.
Work closely with growth, marketing, product and strategy to promote the implementation of conclusions and bring business-wide improvements.
Investigate and attribute data anomalies, build automated anomaly attribution tools.
Support Livo data foundations, ranging from data modeling to tooling to consume data across the organisation.
Contribute to building a data-driven culture within Livo.


Your profile

What We're Looking For


Bachelor's degree or above, majoring in statistics or data science is preferred.
At least 3+ years of experience in growth analytics, data analysis, or a similar role in a high-performance technology company
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality insights. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Python.
Knowledge of modern data tools such as Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivanet.
Experience with data visualization tools like Metabase, Looker, or similar platforms.
Experience with A/B testing, experimentation, and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and management services.
Strong spoken and written English and Spanish is a must. Other languages are nice to have.
Self-starter with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.


Why us?

At Livo Health, we offer a unique opportunity to make a tangible impact in the healthcare space. You will play a pivotal role in scaling our operations, all while working alongside passionate individuals who are driven to make a difference.


High Growth: Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with countless opportunities for personal and professional development.
Competitive salary package: reflecting your experience and expertise, ensuring you are rewarded for your hard work and dedication
Meaningful equity package: We truly want team members to own a relevant part of the business as a key driver to fully buy into the equity story and the change we‚Äôre trying to promote in the world, with the corresponding economic upside that goes with it
Innovation: Be at the forefront of transforming healthcare staffing through technology and innovative operational processes.
Impact: Help solve one of healthcare‚Äôs most critical issues ‚Äî healthcare professional talent crisis/shortage ‚Äî and make a real-world impact on healthcare providers and patients alike.
Cool & vibrant Offices: Very well located offices at the heart of Barcelona in Paseo de Gracia with plenty of natural light, great views, spacious and cool vibes
Culture: Strong culture with an emphasis on ownership, impact, and ambition, coupled with the determination to build something meaningful whilst enjoying the journey
Benefits: We will soon rollout a benefits program in line with market standards


Interview Process

Our hiring process is designed to assess both your skills and cultural fit with our mission-driven team:


Call with HR: initial conversation to assess motivation, culture fit and salary expectations
45-minute interview with our VP of Growth, David
60-minute technical SQL & Programming call with Backend Engineer
45-minute Case Study with our VP of Growth and CEO
45-minute culture fit call with CTO


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Analista de datos (M/H)
Description:
En Empresas IMAN, estamos en b√∫squeda de un/a Analista de Datos para formar parte del equipo de Servicios Centrales con sede en Terrassa.




Buscamos un profesional con experiencia en la creaci√≥n de informes interactivos en Power BI y desarrollo de aplicaciones en PowerApps. Crear y mantener reportes interactivos que visualicen datos de forma clara.
Optimizar modelos de datos y aplicar f√≥rmulas DAX para obtener m√©tricas relevantes.

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

‚Ä¢ Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

‚Ä¢Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

‚Ä¢Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

‚Ä¢Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

‚Ä¢Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

‚Ä¢ SQL advanced

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

‚Ä¢ Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

‚Ä¢ Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

‚Ä¢ AWS

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure cloud computing

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with DataOps principles

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Agile methodologies

‚Ä¢ Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

‚Ä¢ You have good presentation skills.

‚Ä¢ You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

‚Ä¢ You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
In November of 2024, Printful and Printify came together as two equals and merged to form a global on-demand powerhouse. This role will involve working across our two platforms and brands, a unique and special challenge. To learn more about the merger, check out our blog post.

About The Role

Join us as a Data Quality Analyst, where your meticulous attention to finance data ensures the availability, completeness, and accuracy of essential information. Your primary focus will be on establishing efficient data retrieval processes and ensuring the highest quality of source data. You will be responsible for gathering all relevant financial data, ensuring its accuracy and prompt availability. A key part of your role will be developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, and conducting business tests to identify and resolve any issues.

Your Daily Tasks will Entail:


Maintain the accuracy of finance data in the data warehouse by developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, driving the resolution of identified errors
Collaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to improve data pipelines
Develop source data tables for finance reporting needs and design scalable data models that facilitate accurate and insightful decision-making
Drive company-wide data accessibility by advocating for self-service data usage and utilizing BI tools such as Looker to empower teams with actionable insights
Keep processes organized and well-documented, contributing to process improvements and ensuring efficiency, particularly during month-end closing activities
Foster cross-functional collaboration by ensuring effective communication and alignment between finance and data teams, supporting seamless integration and cooperation



Your Qualifications:


At least 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Developer/Data Analyst
At least 2 years of experience building and enhancing Looker applications and administration
Well-versed in Python and SQL coding
Skills in data modeling and business logic processes
Experience with DWH design
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Able to work in a highly collaborative environment
Proactive attitude and ability to work independently, taking ownership of projects and delivering high-quality results within deadlines
Able to demonstrate knowledge of dimensional modeling, and data visualization techniques



What we Offer:


All the resources and tools to perform your tasks (choose between Mac or Windows)
An opportunity to work remotely or in a modern and welcoming office in Rƒ´ga
Flexible working hours (start your day as late as 11 a.m.)
Health insurance, including a mental wellness program
Employee discounts for 300+ premium products
Room for professional growth (conferences, workshops, mentoring, guest lectures)
Exciting team-building events and parties you‚Äôll never forget!



We are an equal opportunity workplace. We‚Äôre committed to diversity and inclusion and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and work experience.

Interested, but don‚Äôt think this is the right fit for you? Feel free to share it with friends and check out other open positions at our career's site. We‚Äôre always looking for creative and driven minds to join our ever-growing team.

Title: Talent Data & Automation Analyst
Description:
‚ö°Do you dare to lead the digital transformation to create a more sustainable world? üå≥

At Schneider Electric, we are the leading digital partner in sustainability and efficiency for businesses, communities, and individuals. Our goal is for all people to be able to make the most of our energy and resources through the integration of processes, software, big data, and energy technologies that enable integrated management of buildings, industries, and cities. We are present in over 110 countries with a diverse and disruptive team of over 150,000 people. If you are seeking an opportunity to propel your career and challenge your creativity, we want to meet you!

Schneider Digital is the digital department of Schneider Electric, leading the digital transformation in the company by giving support globally to our internal teams and our clients. Schneider Digital consists of 6 Digital Hubs worldwide which are strategically located to ensure a 24/7 support across the company (France, China, India, USA, Mexico and Spain). Our Digital Hub in Barcelona is formed by +450 employees working in strategic projects and different roles such as Data, Cybersecurity, ERP, Cloud, Infrastructures, IT Project Management or Digital Marketing.

We are looking for a Senior, Talent Management Data & Automation Analyst to join our dynamic Human Resources global Digital team in Barcelona.

What will you do?

In this role you‚Äôll have 2 key missions:

Data: Turn raw data into useful insights that help the Schneider Digital Human Resources team to take people decisions, e.g. individuals future such as promotion, development, succession, and/or designing global programs to accelerate upskilling, readiness, etc. Your technical specialized skills mixed with HR domain expertise will help you find patterns, predict changes, and suggest data-driven solutions for business questions.
Automation: Simplify and automate all talent management process driving efficiency and seamless employee experience

Main responsibilities:

Ensure data quality, timely feed, maintenance, and communication/training to users on the suit of dashboards we have related to Talent Management (includes Tableau and Oracle)
Simplification & automation of talent management flow for day-to-day operations or program deployments
Support Global HRBPs on having handy, up-to-date data in a one stop shop according to needs
Leveraging the power of data talent management blind spots and proposing innovative talent solutions
Driving program deployments facing managers, HRBPs and employees

What qualifications will make you successful for this role?

Education: Degree or master‚Äôs in Data Management, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience: 2-4 years of experience in a similar role
Experienced in data analysis, data process, and data management. Data visualization tools and power automate flows.
Ability to audit, clean and process data. Build data models & map use cases. Interpret and display data using different approaches and data visualization tools. Build key insights that lead to better informed and successful decision-making.
Good knowledge of Tableau, Power Automate, Phyton, R or other statistical programming languages
Oracle Human Resources / Analytics, ThoughtSpot or similar
Experience in Human Resources is a plus
Microsoft Office suite
Languages: Fluent in English (written and spoken)

Soft Skills:

Comfortable in multicultural environment
Able to translate technical solutions and problems for non-technical audiences
Continuous learning and curiosity
Autonomous, efficient and results driven
Organized and high attention to details and data accuracy
Manages sensitive and confidential information

What will you get?

We adapt to you:

üïì With our flexible schedule, you'll have the freedom to adjust your work hours to accommodate your personal needs and responsibilities.

üíª We know how great it is to work from home. With our hybrid work plan, you can enjoy working from the comfort of your home.

üèù Need more time to relax and disconnect? With our Holy Pack, you can purchase additional vacation days to recharge when you need it most.

üìÖ Celebrate holidays your way! With Floating Holidays, you can exchange holidays for other days that better suit your plans and personal preferences.

üßòNeed additional time to explore new experiences or focus on personal projects? With the Sabbatical Pack, you can request up to 2 months of extra leave (unpaid).

üíû We value the importance of family and want to support you in all aspects of your life. Our Global Family Leave Policy provides flexible paid conditions for when you need it most, whether you're about to be a parent, need time to overcome a loss, or to care for a loved one.

We take care of you:

üì± With access to the health and wellness platform Wellwo, you and up to 5 people of your choice can enjoy access to wellness content, nutrition counseling, fitness classes, and more!

üèÑFrom dance classes to booking a hotel spa, we offer an agreement with Wellhub so you can access a network of thousands of gyms and sports centers to keep your body active in the way you like best.

ü©∫ Your well-being is our priority. You will have medical service at your workplace for close attention to any medical needs.

We empower you:

üéØ With Open Talent Market, our AI-driven professional development platform, you can connect with job opportunities, projects, and mentors at Schneider Electric globally.

ü§ë We offer you the opportunity to be a shareholder of Schneider Electric and share in our achievements with our stock ownership program.

üôå We celebrate everyone's talent and success with our recognition program, through which you can give and receive points for your achievements and redeem them for gift cards at your favorite stores.

üíó You will have life insurance for your protection.

üí∞ We offer you a Flexible Remuneration Plan in which you can choose from a variety of options, such as health insurance, meal vouchers, childcare vouchers, transportation vouchers, training, and more.

üéÅ With Club Schneider, you will enjoy special discounts at your favorite stores, restaurants, travel agencies, and other external services.

üíö Participate in company-subsidized volunteer programs to contribute to our community and have a positive impact on your environment.




DIGDATA24

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

€36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World‚Äôs most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‚Äòinclusion‚Äô is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:


Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.

Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:

  • Design, develop, reports and dashboards
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
  • Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
  • Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
  • Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
  • Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices

Continuous Improvement & Documentation:

  • Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
  • Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.

Data Quality & Validation:

  • Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.

Support the Finance team‚Äôs evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users‚Äô community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau¬Æ (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Hybrid -
Barcelona, Spain
Analytics
Permanent - Full Time

Job ID: r19179

What You'll Do


Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from different stakeholders ‚Äì Commercial teams, Sales Operations, FP&A, Sales Compensation etc.
Develop and maintain self-service automated reporting in support of Commercial teams, Sales Operations and Finance teams using Power BI, Python or any other relevant technologies
Work collaboratively with the IIT Team to continuously improve the dataflows, reporting back end etc. as well as to improve the customer experience (UX/UI), in order to maximize the reporting outputs
Stay up to date with the latest BI tools and technologies, and make recommendations for new tools and approaches that could improve our BI capabilities
Monitor and maintain current reporting processes & data integrity that are relying on data from different systems and platforms
Incorporate feature requests or new tools into product roadmap based on leadership / end users business needs in order to optimize sales processes
Provide support on a daily basis to end users on any issues/blockers they might face and fix any bugs according to our SOPs
Coordinate trainings to end users on new reporting tools, processes and best practices
Develop strong project management skills to support our growth and organizational changes


Who You Are


2-3 years of experience working within BI or/and Data analytics
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.) or in Business, Finance with equivalent practical experience
SQL proficiency is required
Extensive previous working with Power BI
Background in any of the following is a plus: Python, Tableau, Databricks, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop, MS SQL Studio
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure & solve complex problems in an autonomous way
Exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the bigger picture
Thorough conceptual and practical understanding of relational databases, data architecture/governance, and real-world application of statistical concepts
Combining technical skills, passion for learning and the ability to interact with a diverse group of stakeholders in a dynamic environment
Excellent communication skills in English


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile game studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games consistently rank among the top on iOS and Android, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, our mission is simple: to create amazing gaming experiences and bring fun to everyone!

We‚Äôre looking for a Game Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role, you'll analyze player behavior, collaborate with game teams, and help improve our games by driving retention and user conversion.

Using quantitative analysis, data science, statistics, and programming, you‚Äôll generate insights that make a real impact at Socialpoint. To succeed, you‚Äôll need to learn quickly, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work closely with both analytics and game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working model from home and office. What does this mean? You need to live within commuting distance of our Barcelona office to attend important meetings and events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona, if you're not already here.
An impressive 25 days of annual leave, not including public holidays.
An additional 5 days of annual leave during Christmas.
Full Catering for Breakfast and lunch at the office
Private medical insurance for you and your family to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest iOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons in English and Spanish.
Spotify Premium to add a special soundtrack to your adventure.
Legendary social events and parties to let off some steam.
Personal development is key for us: enjoy a significant budget to enhance your skills and knowledge, providing real growth opportunities!


What We Offer You:

Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Gym Facilities: Want to stay in shape? We have state-of-the-art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
New Office: Enjoy our brand-new office, complete with top-tier amenities, including a professional barista and delicious breakfast options.
Onsite Physiotherapist: Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for any aches and pains.
Onsite Hairdressers: Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on and apply now! Click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Diversity & Conclusion Statement

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic ‚Äì not an individual‚Äôs race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint‚Äôs in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint‚Äôs in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast ready to make an impact? Join our team as a Data Analyst, where you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in shaping our company‚Äôs future through sharp analysis, strategic insight, and proactive collaboration.

Key Responsibilities

Insight Generation & Analytics


Answer business questions using a wide range of data techniques.
Develop concise one-page documents with actionable insights and business recommendations.
Conduct in-depth analyses to solve key business problems.
Translate complex data into clear and concise presentations for senior management and stakeholders, effectively communicating key findings and recommendations.
Create compelling visualizations to effectively communicate key metrics to stakeholders.


Machine Learning & AI


Develop and deploy machine learning models to solve and automate key business problems and processes.
Foster an AI-driven culture within Holaluz by researching and disseminating AI knowledge across the company.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and assess their suitability for Holaluz.


Data Warehousing


Populate the Data Warehouse with datasets using Python and SQL to create robust data pipelines.
Optimize and evolve the data warehousing infrastructure to ensure cost-effectiveness and scalability.
Maintain the smooth and efficient operation of Data Analytics systems.


What We‚Äôre Looking For

Education & Experience


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field
3‚Äì5 years of experience working as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Data Engineer.


Key Skills & Attributes


Expertise in SQL and Python language.
Analytical and strategic thinking with a proven ability to solve complex problems.
Good communication skills to distill intricate concepts into actionable insights.
Previous experience working with a visualization tool such as Power BI, QlikView, Tableau, etc.
A proactive, detail-oriented professional with a solution-focused mindset.
Team player who thrives both independently and in collaborative environments.
A positive, energetic attitude that aligns with our SHAKE culture:


‚óã Say things as they are

‚óã Have fun

‚óã Always people first

‚óã Keep rowing together

‚óã Es posible

Why Join Us?

This role is more than just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs an opportunity to drive meaningful impact within a fast-paced, forward-thinking organization. If you‚Äôre optimistic, hardworking, and excited to grow within a culture of transparency, collaboration, and possibility, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.
