Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analysts at Thoughtworks collect, process and analyze large datasets to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making for our clients. They are responsible for the strategy, implementation, productionization and articulation of business impact. They collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. They stay up-to-date with industry advancements, ensure data quality and security, and actively mentor other Thoughtworkers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.

Job responsibilities


You will perform data extraction and modeling to generate insights and make recommendations for the business.
You will support the definition and construction of KPIs that best represent the business performance of our clients, assisting in decision-making processes.
You will work on the development and maintenance of strategic dashboards, reports and KPIs.
You will use storytelling practices for effective dashboard construction.
You will build solutions and validate hypotheses through comprehensive data analysis.
You will design, conduct and measure both qualitative and quantitative research.
You will create proposals and conduct A/B tests.
You will conduct ad-hoc studies as needed.
You will connect with stakeholders to understand database structures, apply necessary business rules and share analysis methods and methodologies.



Job Qualifications

Technical Skills


You have expertise with Tableau as a self-service BI tool.
You have experience in analytics and business intelligence projects.
You have proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets.
You have strong data visualization practices with relevant tools.
You have proficiency in database management, either relational or non-relational.
You have advanced knowledge in SQL and Python.
You have ability to clean, prepare and analyze big data, both structured and unstructured.
You have exploratory, qualitative and quantitative analysis skills.
You have experience with research techniques and satisfaction indicators.
You have ability to identify patterns, actionable insights and relationships in data.



Professional Skills


You have great stakeholder management skills and you are able to build rapport and gain buy-in from clients and key stakeholders.
You are a great problem solver, thrive in ambiguity, tackle challenges from various angles and embrace risk management.
You have a data-driven approach, seeking opportunities to leverage data for efficiency and value, and actively collaborate to drive data-based decisions.
You are a great communicator and have the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
You are a team player and actively collaborate with colleagues and other teams.
You are eager to coach, mentor and motivate others and you aspire to influence teammates to take positive action and accountability for their work.
English and Spanish communication and relationship building skills ‚Äì written, verbal, facilitation, etc, are a must.



Other things to know

Learning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a dynamic and inclusive community of bright and supportive colleagues who are revolutionizing tech. As a leading technology consultancy, we‚Äôre pushing boundaries through our purposeful and impactful work. For 30+ years, we‚Äôve delivered extraordinary impact together with our clients by helping them solve complex business problems with technology as the differentiator. Bring your brilliant expertise and commitment for continuous learning to Thoughtworks. Together, let‚Äôs be extraordinary.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

In this role, you will work closely with a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to source, analyze, and visualize data from various internal teams and systems. You will transform complex datasets into easy-to-understand, actionable insights, helping our marketing team and executives make informed decisions. Your role will include collaboration with multiple teams and the ability to explain data trends, limitations, and strategic implications effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Data Sourcing & Integration:


Interface with cross-functional teams, including Measurement, Insights & Data Science, MAP market share and Category teams, Finance, Media, Customer Experience, and others, to gather relevant data.
Combine and harmonize data from multiple sources to create comprehensive datasets for analysis.


Data Analysis & Insight Generation


Conduct thorough analyses to detect and interpret trends and patterns, with a focus on deriving actionable insights from performance metrics, competitive intelligence, and evolving market trends.
Transform these insights into strategic recommendations to propel forward our marketing strategies and adapt to competitive pressures and market dynamics.


Visualization & Reporting


Develop and refine visualizations, dashboards, and comprehensive reports that clearly articulate complex data sets. Ensure these tools not only convey information effectively but also facilitate strategic decision-making, thereby enhancing marketing initiatives and business results.


Stakeholder Communication


Clearly articulate data findings, limitations, and implications to non-technical stakeholders, including marketing teams and executive leadership.
Assist the Senior Data Analyst in preparing and delivering presentations to internal teams and executives.


Qualifications & Skills

Education and Experience Required:


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
4-7 years of work experience, preferably in marketing, data analytics, market research, customer research or customer experience strategy, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience


Technical Skills


Proficiency in both Excel and Power Point, experience with data visualization in Power BI and SQL.
Familiarity with marketing analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) is a plus.


Soft Skills


Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Clear and concise communication skills, with the ability to explain data findings to non-technical audiences.
Attention to detail and a proactive approach to tasks.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview

The Celergo Streamline Organization (CSL) is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring, developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to clients and associates.

Within the CSL Implementation department we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to lead data analysis and reporting efforts within the department.

What will I be doing?


You will formulate analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations
You will work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects
You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
You will be a champion for data-based decision making
You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes


What skills will I need?


You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined.
You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset


How will I know that I am successful at it?


Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels
Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller


Qualifications And Experience


3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus.
Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
University degree or equivalent in education or experience.


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

  • You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
  • You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
  • You will be a champion for data-based decision making
  • You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
  • You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes

What skills will I need?

  • You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
  • You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
  • You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
  • You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
  • You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
  • You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
  • You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
  • You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
  • You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined.
  • You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
  • You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
  • You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
  • You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset

How will I know that I am successful at it?

  • Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
  • Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels
  • Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller

Qualifications And Experience

  • 3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
  • Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
  • Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus.
  • Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
  • Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
  • You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
  • Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
  • University degree or equivalent in education or experience.

A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions
Design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies
Create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions
Develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making
Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements
Work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices


Professional competencies:


Several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
Experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams
Familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus)
Experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus)


Personal competencies:


Proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills
Work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support
Hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights
Productive and capable of acting in critical situations
Communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Soledad Barrag√°n L√≥pez

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you‚Äôll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry‚Äôs top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city‚Äôs best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.
Show more

Ejecutar procesos de migraci√≥n de datos y dar soporte en tareas de ETL.

About Sanoma Learning

How do you prepare students for the world, engage their curiosity and inspire them to grow? That is the main question of teachers all around the world. At Sanoma Learning, it has always been our mission to help to find and develop best-in-class answers to this question. If you join us, it means that you embark on an exciting journey to help shape the future of learning for primary, secondary and vocational education. We believe that your journey is our success as a company.

Sanoma Learning is a leading K12 European learning company, operating in 12 countries. Our learning products and services enable and support teachers and schools to develop the talents of every child to reach their potential. By offering printed and digital learning content, as well as digital learning and teaching platforms for primary, secondary and vocational education, we want to grow our positive impact on learning across Europe. With over 3000 employees, we help shape the future of education for 25+ million of students.

So, are you ready to start your journey to help shape the future of learning and help teachers to support all students to reach their potential?

Sanoma Learning is an equal opportunity employer; we are committed to inclusion and diversity, ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers‚Äô campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
Show more

As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do



Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton‚Äôs privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy



Job Requirements



Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.



Bonus points for:



Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Analyst - Tech - Data Protection
Description:
[Please note this is a Direct Search led by Bacardi, Applications from agencies will not be accepted nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.]

About The Role

The Data Responsibility Program is built on three essential pillars: Personal Information Privacy, Data Protection, and Data Security. We collaborate closely with the Cyber Security Team, leveraging their critical activities, and the Business Integrity Team, especially the Data Protection Lead, who offers vital legal support. This role is pivotal in driving the growth of the Data Responsibility Program, contributing to the continuous development of processes and technical controls to identify, classify, securely handle, retain, and dispose of data.

Key Accountabilities And Responsibilities

In this role, the ideal candidate will exhibit exceptional attention to detail, ensuring all tasks are completed with precision and accuracy. They will be a quick and curious learner, adept at grasping new technical and legal concepts. With technical proficiency across various tools and platforms, they will excel in problem-solving skills, finding pragmatic solutions to knotty organizational challenges.

Key responsibilities include:


Program Growth: Support the continued growth and development of the Data Responsibility program (internal candidates can refer to Data Responsibility for more program information).
Privacy UX: Assist in maturing the privacy user experience, ensuring that public-facing and Primo-facing sites are compliant and user-friendly.
Data Protection Initiatives: Help evolve data protection initiatives to discover, classify, catalogue, and protect personal and commercially sensitive information.
Project and Change Management: Assist with project management and change management tasks related to data responsibility initiatives.
Risk Assessments and Record Keeping: Support the team in performing activity risk assessments and maintaining records of processing.
Data Analysis: Perform deep analysis of data to identify predominant topics and trends.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with business and tech stakeholders to understand their ways of working with data, with the aim of improving business efficiency.
Efficiency Improvement: Spot opportunities to improve efficiency and automation within the organisation.
Technology Advancement: Help prepare the business to take appropriate advantage of advancing technologies such as Artificial Intelligence.


Critical Experiences For Success


To be successful in this role you will have/be:
Minimum 3 years‚Äô experience in similar work within TECH
Evidence and strong analytics aptitude and capability
Evidence of independent thinking and working
Track record of strong task delivery
Comfortable engaging with other key business stakeholders across TECH, Business and 3rd Party partners.


Leadership Excellence

Living our Values and demonstrating high Learning Agility will be fundamental not only for success in this role, but also for potential growth to other roles across Bacardi in the future. We have a clearly defined Leadership Excellence framework: Focus Externally to Win / Drive Execution & Results / Lead Strategically & Know your Business / Make the Matrix Work / Lead by Example and Develop and Inspire Talent

LEADERSHIP AGILITY

At Bacardi we care deeply about finding brilliant talent who can bring the following personal attributes to help elevate our 3Fs: Fearless, Family, Founder culture to the next level.


Belonging: You have a strong capacity to create a culture of ‚ÄòBelonging‚Äô, where people feel appreciated for who they are, what they do, and who they can become
Self-Awareness: You have high levels of self-awareness, are reflective and know yourself well, understanding both your own strengths and weaknesses and your impact on others
People Agility: You bring a deep ability to understand and relate to people and navigate through tough situations to harness and multiply collective performance
Results Agility: You demonstrate consistent delivery of results in first-time situations by inspiring teams, exhibiting a presence that builds confidence in yourself and others.
Mental Agility: You can think critically to penetrate complex problems and expand the possibilities by making fresh connections. You think strategically whilst being execution focused and bring creativity to the challenges you‚Äôre presented with
Change Agility: You have a deep natural curiosity, desire to experiment and ability to effectively deal with the heat of change. You have a growth and learning mindset: ready to test, stumble, learn and apply from experience


Disclaimer: Bacardi seeks talent from all backgrounds to bring diversity of thought, agility and capability to our organization across the globe. We promote a working environment where all employees are treated and rewarded fairly. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination that adversely affects individuals or groups on the basis of national origin, race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, and any other legally protected aspect of a person‚Äôs identity.

U.S. applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws.

Perks of Working for us

At Bacardi, we are committed to providing our Primos (employees) with a comprehensive Total Rewards package of compensation, benefits, incentives, allowances, well-being, and much more to meet the needs of themselves and their families. It goes beyond just Cash! The total rewards program is based on pay for performance, whereby the incentive programs are linked to company and individual performance.

Compensation, Paid Time Off & Retirement:


Competitive Pay Package
Competitive Holiday/Paid Time Off, plus additional days offered ( i.e., volunteer day, allowing you to give back to the community)
Retirement/Pension Plan


Health & Wellbeing


Medical, Critical Illness, and Life Insurance
Calm Meditation App subscription (free)
Employee Assistance Programs
Best-in-class, family-friendly, and inclusive leave policies


Additional Benefits

The benefits /perks may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Bacardi, your work location, and are subject to change.

Some benefits may be subject to an employee contribution.

Some benefits may be fully or partially subsidized. Incentive plans are linked to the nature of your employment and can vary based on region, market, function or brand.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos.




El ritmo de vida actual lleva a muchas personas a tener que elegir entre comer comer rico y comer sano o a priorizar la rapidez, dejando en un segundo plano la calidad y sabor de lo que comen en su d√≠a a d√≠a. Por eso en Wetaca cocinamos para que comer genial est√© al alcance de todos y la comida sea un sin√≥nimo de disfrute, bienestar y tranquilidad.




Somos la suscripci√≥n semanal de comida a domicilio l√≠der del mercado y repartimos en toda la pen√≠nsula. Cocinamos comida casera y real (con ingredientes naturales, sin aditivos ni conservantes y todo desde cero) para ofrecer men√∫s variados y para todos los gustos, para que nuestros clientes coman bien y ganen tiempo para s√≠ mismos. Nuestro objetivo es que conf√≠en en nosotros y nos deleguen el preparar su comida, que sepan que We TAke CAre, que nosotros nos encargamos de todo.




Si eres una persona con hambre y buscas un sitio en el que crecer, tenemos una vacante para ti.




Buscamos un Product Data Analyst con 2-3 a√±os de experiencia, capaz de entender las necesidades del producto digital y transformarlas en datos e insights accionables para mejorar la experiencia de nuestros usuarios. Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




Would you like to work for a company where hospitality is a work of heart and you can be all you are?

Our purpose is to pioneer the art of responsible hospitality, connecting cultures with heartfelt care. With over 230,000 hospitality experts in more than 40+ hotel brands, we nurture a real passion for service and achievement beyond limits.

At the Accor Global Reservation Centre, we offer memorable experiences to our clients.

You will be part of an international team helping guests offering them the best experience when making the reservation in the luxury hotels around the world. You will be sharing your expertise and knowledge of our spectacular, world-class locations and properties while having authentic conversations with guests.




Job Description




Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you'll turn complex data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and contribute to our organization's success




Job Purpose




As a Business and Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our center's business strategy, leveraging data insights to drive decision-making, optimize operations, and increase revenue. You will report directly to the hotel operations manager and oversee the WFM analyst activities.

In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing Global Reservation Centre reporting and analyses, providing the foundation for informed business decisions. Your work will directly support operational improvements and revenue growth, making you a valuable contributor to our international and dynamic team.




Main Duties:




Consolidate reporting requirements from different regions, hotels, and centers, and prepare recurring performance reports for various stakeholders
Analyze complex data, identify anomalies, and provide actionable insights to support decision-making
Guide business line contacts in asking the right questions to drive data-driven decisions through effective storytelling
Build and enhance Global Reservation Centre reporting and dashboards to monitor daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance
Manage the master database, ensure data quality from multiple sources, and collaborate with the central data team in Paris to automate processes.
Develop and refine key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve performance
Identify areas for improvement and propose innovative solutions to optimize processes (e.g., automation, operational efficiency, productivity)
Transform raw data into meaningful statistical insights
Stay up to date with new tools and technologies relevant to data analysis and reporting
Act as a business partner for the Global Reservation Centre, providing ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision-making
Promote a positive working environment and champion Accor‚Äôs Culture, Mission, Vision, and Values
Ensure compliance with relevant rules and procedures







Qualifications




Education and/or work experience in Business or Engineering school, specializing in Data, business analytics, and business strategy
Minimum 2 years work experience in a data-driven environment
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Deep knowledge of database languages (SQL); Excel (VBA will be a plus) and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI), understanding the mechanism of CRM tools (Salesforce)
Familiarity with emerging technologies relevant to the industry positions analysts to adapt strategies to changing technological landscapes
Critical thinking, and solution-oriented, while being organized and structured
Agile and know how to adapt to different situations
Full business proficiency in English (written & verbal), a second/third language would be a plus
Hands-on and enjoy getting into the heart of the matter
Strong sense of responsibility and accountability
Respectful and collaborative within a diverse multicultural environment




What We Offer:




A dynamic and supportive work environment.
Opportunities for career growth in a global organization.
Collaboration with a talented, international team.




Additional Information




If you are passionate about luxury and sales, and are looking for a role that values genuine interactions and exceptional guest experiences, apply now to become a Luxury Reservation Consultant with us. Let's create unforgettable experiences together.




Location and Availability Requirements:




Must be currently legally entitled to work full-time in Spain
39 working hours/ week
Current opening hours: Mon-Sun 8am to 10pm




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit, and promote diverse talent.

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS




What It‚Äôs Like to Work at Accor Global Reservation Centre:

LK : Accor GRC Barcelona

IG : GRC Barcelona

TikTok : grc.barcelona

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

Passion, innovation and commitment are our values. If you love challenges and work in an international environment this is the opportunity for you!

Cooltra, European leader in sustainable mobility üõµ is looking for a Data Analyst to join our data team.




Data team

We are proud that we have created a safe space where people can learn, grow and, most importantly, have fun. We celebrate our successes and failures and view everything as an opportunity to learn and improve, with no blame attached. The data team ensures data quality and provides reports and analysis to the overall of the company: Product, Marketing, Operations, etc.




Functions and Responsibilities

Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company stakeholders.
Work collaboratively across all areas of our business to make the most of our data.
Effectively communicate clear recommendations and actionable insight from data to non-technical stakeholders.
Build engaging and interactive visualizations with BI tools.
Define and analyze main Cooltra KPIs.




Requirements

Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related fields
At least, 1 year of experience as a BI/Data Analyst.
Mandatory: live in Spain and have a C1 level of Spanish.
Strong SQL skills.
Experience preparing, consolidating and maintaining data models
Experience with building and maintaining data pipelines
BI tools expertise.




Bonus Points

Good skills to communicate with stakeholders effectively.
Knowledge of best practices for a Data Warehouse management.
Previous experience with tools such as Airflow, Airbyte or dbt.
Experience in Mobility, Energy or Automotive industry.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken.




What do we offer?

Enviable working environment be part of an international organisation that values diversity and collaboration.
Full-time and permanent contract: 40-hours working week (Mon-Fri)
Competitive fixed and variable remuneration.
Full remote.
Flexible remuneration: through Cobee, we adapt your remuneration to your real needs, reducing your taxes.
Day off on your birthday: celebrate your special day as you deserve and enjoy a well-deserved day off.
Health benefits: health insurance with a promotional price, so you can take care of you and your loved ones.
Exclusive discounts for Cooltra employees: enjoy a 50% discount on all Cooltra services.
Personal and professional growth: access training opportunities to enhance your career and skills.
Additional offers and discounts: multiple offers thanks to our partners in services such as gym, restaurants, etc.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capitole Consulting is growing, and we want you to be part of it!

We are looking for a Tableau Data Analyst




Requirements:

Experience Level: minimum 2 years in an analytical role and proficiency in English.




Technical Skills:

Tableau proficiency: experience in creating dashboards and visualizations, including advanced features like calculated fields, parameters, and actions.
Strong SQL skills: ability to query, manage, and analyze large datasets.
Solid understanding of data structures, relational databases, and ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




Daily Responsibilities:

Use SQL to query databases, extract and prepare clean datasets for analysis and reporting.
Update and enhance Tableau dashboards to ensure accuracy, functionality, and relevance for stakeholders.
Generate and distribute automated reports, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide data-driven insights to support business decisions.
Validate data accuracy in dashboards and reports, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability across all outputs.
Collaborate with teams to understand their data needs, provide insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.
Continuously refine SQL queries, Tableau workflows, and reporting processes while staying up to date with industry best practices and new tools.




Why Join Us?

We are amazing, but with you, we‚Äôll be even better! üòä

Benefits:

‚Ç¨1,200 training budget to use on tech events, books, certifications, or courses of your choice.
Monthly team check-ins for continuous feedback.
Flexible working hours to balance your professional and personal life.
Private health insurance, fully covered by Capitole.
Flexible compensation options (meal vouchers, transport, daycare).
Andjoy (Gymforless) membership.
Exclusive employee discounts at top brands through Club Capitole.

Team Culture & Social Perks:

Team buildings every two months ‚Äì don‚Äôt miss our Summer Party or Christmas Dinner!
Capitole-sponsored football team.
Tech communities to share knowledge and ideas across teams ‚Äì internal knowledge sharing is key! üòÉ

Want to know more about us?

üåê Check us out: https://capitole-consulting.com/ ‚≠ê See what employees say: Glassdoor Reviews

Don‚Äôt hesitate to send us your profile ‚Äì we‚Äôre excited to meet you! üöÄ

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üè¢ About Us



We are a software company developing CRM solutions for the healthcare sector, trusted by top healthcare providers across Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, and beyond. Since 2019, we have been part of DocPlanner Group, Europe and Latin America's leading healthtech SaaS unicorn, dedicated to transforming healthcare and enhancing the patient experience.



For more about us, visit https://www.tuotempo.es/





Job Description



üéØ The Role



We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona! üöÄ
As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.



üîç Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities



Data Analysis (40%) ‚Äì Extract, analyze, and interpret data to generate actionable insights.
Data Visualization (30%) ‚Äì Build dashboards and reports using Looker, Tableau, or similar tools.
Data Quality (20%) ‚Äì Ensure accuracy and consistency in data sources.
Data Modeling (10%) ‚Äì Support business teams with modeling and structuring data for analysis.

You will collaborate closely with Product, DevOps, Backend, and Operations teams, working on 80% project-based tasks and 20% ad-hoc requests.





Qualifications



‚ú® What Will Make You Shine



üõ† Must-Have Requirements



1-2 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills ‚Äì ability to translate data into insights.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì ability to present data clearly and concisely.
Fluent in English (Italian and Spanish are a plus).
Attention to detail ‚Äì high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.

üéØ Nice-to-Have Requirements



Experience with Python or other programming languages.
Familiarity with BigQuery, AWS, or other data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
Experience in product damanagement, SaaS, or tech industry.
Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.


Additional Information



üöÄ Why Join Us?



üåü What Makes This Role Exciting?



Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.
